intro: Picris hieracium, commonly known as common groundsel, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa, and has been naturalized in many other regions. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, with hairy stems and alternate leaves that are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture. Its yellow flowers are arranged in composite flower heads, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds that are dispersed by wind. Picris hieracium is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in meadows.
